Description: Fragment of rim of South Ionian Wild Goat style pottery plate; worn slip inside; very micaceous clay, quite coarse. Underside has frieze of rays at the centre, suggesting a central stem, and glazed to the outside. Inside, most of an elongated goat, grazing to right. Drilled for analysis.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.904)
